lead_paragraph: Ahmad Rahami’s life seemed stuck. Then he found jihad on the internet and fell under the sway of a radical cleric in Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Fahim Abed, Salman Masood, Sarah Maslin Nir, Nate Schweber and Michael Schwirtz. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By KIM BARKER, PIR ZUBAIR SHAH, JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

headline.print_headline: From Class Clown to Manhattan Bomb Suspect
headline.main: Journey From Class Clown to Suspect in Chelsea Bombing

snippet: Ahmad Rahami’s life seemed stuck. Then he found jihad on the internet and fell under the sway of a radical cleric in Pakistan....
abstract: Chelsea bombing suspect Ahmad Khan Rahami is described as class clown who initially rebelled against strict Muslim upbringing at home and later turned to attack country that welcomed his immigrant parents; Rahami's story reflects those of many other frustrated young men from immigrant families, but is also unique in that he grew up hating Taliban and Pakistan and long rejected cultural conservatism.
